meanings.definition: To ruin or destroy something completely.
meanings.sent1: The storm banjaxing the old barn was a sad sight.
meanings.sent2: She accidentally banjaxed her phone by dropping it in water.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy was banjaxing the garden with its digging.
meanings.sent4: The virus banjaxed the computer system overnight.
meanings.sent5: The reckless driver banjaxed the mailbox with his car.

meanings.definition: Causing something to be ruined or destroyed.
meanings.sent1: The banjaxing storm left a trail of destruction behind.
meanings.sent2: The banjaxing earthquake shattered the fragile glassware.
meanings.sent3: The banjaxing party guests accidentally broke the vase.
meanings.sent4: The banjaxing noise from the construction site disrupted the peace.
meanings.sent5: The banjaxing paint job on the old house made it look worse.

meanings.definition: The act of ruining or destroying something completely.
meanings.sent1: The banjaxing of the ancient artifact was a tragedy.
meanings.sent2: The banjaxing of the cake happened when it fell on the floor.
meanings.sent3: The banjaxing of the plan led to chaos in the office.
meanings.sent4: The banjaxing of the garden by the storm required days of cleanup.
meanings.sent5: The banjaxing of the relationship was unexpected and painful.
